document.description: Berlitz Where to Go in Hong Kong
document.name: WhereToHongKong

lexUnit.definition: COD: prepare to go in a particular direction or do a particular thing

sentence.text: Meredith backed out slowly to avoid other shoppers making for their cars with their overladen squeaky trolleys and set off out of town .
He turned on his heel and made off towards his car without waiting for a reply .
Mr Piggott found himself quite dazzled by the warmth of her smile as she made for the door , and was unable to speak .
Not trusting herself to speak , she right-wheeled and made for her own front door , which now looked hopelessly out of date and shabby .
He stood up at the same time as she did , and caught her as she made for the door .
People were making for the exits .
He struggled from one field to another , making for the safety of the hills .
At once he made for the hill .
Crilly makes for the kitchen .
Carrie kissed her husband lightly on the cheek and made for the stairs .
He screamed and almost lost his footing as he made for the stairs .
I head off along the road and make for Deptford High Street , swinging my bag of clothes like I was going on holiday .
I made straight for the curtains , and he went by me without noticing .
Finally , we make for home , heading past Vengsøya towards the mainland .
So she made for the orchard first .
He turned and made for the stern of the boat , and disappeared below .
Enrique headed through the field at the back of the garage making for the woods to the north .
Rising from his sturdy wooden bench , Bash blew out his candle and made towards his bed .
Since he made swiftly towards the forest , I had not much option but to follow .
Marian knew they had no choice but to make cautiously towards it .
His head ached as he made towards the observation point above the cottages .
We made towards them , picking our way over a welter of tracks .
Hundreds of Californians made their way to their computers after the quake , and checked in with each other on electronic bulletin boards , which link computers CB-radio-style , via phone lines .
The New Territories can be explored by taking the Kowloon - Canton Railway ( KCR ) , which makes 10 stops between the station in Kowloon and Sheung Shui , the last stop before entering China .
The main highway makes a circuit of the New Territories , beginning with the new town of Tsuen Wan , situated in an area of heavy industry just west of Kowloon .
You can build an appetite for dinner by making your way from the beach to the restaurant .
Four comfortable express trains depart the Kowloon - Canton Railway ( KCR ) Station in Hung Hom , Kowloon , making the trip in less than two hours .
" He seems to have broken through the shrubbery and made for the road . "

It had been arranged , therefore , that in such a case his two subordinates were to make for some prearranged spot where they could escape investigation and be in a position afterwards to renew their attempt .
